results.title: Salmon people
results.creator_credit: Tony Westman, Shelah Reljic and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The legendary relationship between the West Coast Indians and the salmon, once their staple food, is revealed in this film that contrasts ancient myth and modern reality. We see how Raven finds riches in the harvest of the salmon, only to lose everything through a thoughtless act against the Spirit of the Salmon. So too does modern man jeopardise his living from the sea by heedless action. Images of ancient spear-fishing and primitive smoke-houses contrast with images of today’s Indians operating a seiner and working in a cooperative cannery.

results.title: Salmon's struggle for survival
results.creator_credit: Walford Hewitson, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: How a dilemma facing fisheries authorities of Canada’s west coast is being met and overcome: the need to use the Fraser and other British Colombia rivers for industrial and public uses and also to keep them uncontaminated and unobstructed so as not to impede the Pacific salmon in its annual upstream migration to freshwater spawning grounds. Of concern, too, is the conservation of young fry in their downstream run to the sea.

results.title: Sally of the sawdust
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on a stage play “Sally of the Sawdust” features the first screen appearance of W.C. Fields and is a silent romantic comedy directed by the great D.W. Griffith. The drama starts in a circus during the Twenties and introduces the story of an orphan Sally (Carol Dempster) and her loveable, juggler, circus performing carer Prof. Eustace P. McGarcle (Fields). Sally is initially unaware that McGargle is not her real father who, through the course of events, decides to reunite her with her grandparents. They make a comedic journey to the town of her grandparents where a wealthy man falls for the circus girl and the drama unfolds. It is a story of mistaken identity, romance and family reunions. The film is known more for being W.C. Fields first screen appearance than one of D.W. Griffith’s greats although it has all the hallmarks of his film genius. It is an entertaining and visually exciting silent melodrama. This version has a music score added. Cast includes Alfred Lunt a theatre actor making a rare screen appearance.

results.title: Salinity: Australia's silent flood. Parts 1-4
results.brief_description: Presented and narrated by David Wenham, this four part documentary series explores what is probably Australia’s most imminent environmental disaster to threaten life as we know it in the 21st Century - SALINITY. Salinity can be devastating in its effects on the land, the soil, the rivers, our drinking water, the various ecosystems which exist on this dry flat continent, and through this program, prominent authorities including palaeontologists, academics, scientists and farmers discuss the threat of salinity from its ancient origins to its future forecasts. Specifically aimed at secondary students, this excellent documentary is powerful in its images and contains some stunning photography of the Australian landscape. Also includes some b&w archival footage. Part one: The Story: Explains the history, the how, why and where, of salinity in Australia covering both dryland salinity and irrigation salinity. Touches on the subjects of land clearing, water irrigation, river drainage systems, water evaporation, rising water table levels, and fragile ecosystems whilst posing questions for which we need answers to understand what the problem is, what the effects will be, and what we may need to do. Part two: The Land: Examines dryland salinity in detail suggesting that millions of hectares of land across Australia is becoming unusable due to the amount of salt which has risen to the surface affecting not only the rural areas but also becoming increasingly an urban problem as the salt eats its way through roads, bridges, buildings and houses. Cites the town of Wagga Wagga (NSW) as an example of a deteriorating infrastructure due to the encroachment of salt and how the community, through public awareness, are managing the problem. Part three: The Water: Focuses on the salinity threat to the Murray-Darling system which provides irrigation water to farmers. The Murray-Darling Basin alone produces 40% of Australia’s agricultural wealth. Also points out that the Murray River not only provides water for agriculture but also services several South Australian cities and that the more water that is used from this system, the more exacerbated the salinity problem becomes. Part four: The Future: Final episode deals more broadly with salinity in Australia and the future. As Tom Hatton from CSIRO warns “1. If nothing is done then our country will get saltier. 2. We cannot concentrate on repairing the past - we must fix the future.” Many questions remain unanswered and there are many obstacles to overcome. However it is imperative that Australia, as a nation, needs to meet this potential environmental disaster head-on now before it is too late. For more information go to www.abc.net.au/learn/silentflood

results.title: Salima in transition
results.creator_credit: Frances Reid, Max Reid and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: A documentary of an African culture in transition. Focuses on a secondary school in the town of Salima in Malawi, a former British colony in central Africa. Shows a group of English speaking students in the process of making the transition from their rural background into the educated class of an emerging nation. Pictures life in Salima, and a visit to a village.

results.title: Salaam Bombay!
results.creator_credit: Mira Nair, Cadrage (Paris), Channel 4 and Mirabai Films
results.brief_description: Abandoned by the travelling fair for which he works, 11 year old Krishna takes a train to the nearest city - Bombay. He is initiated into the ways of the city by various members of a children’s street gang and, determined to save up enough money to get home, begins work at the bottom of the street hierarchy as a “Chaipau” or tea-boy. Through his eyes we glimpse a Bombay never seen in traditional Indian studio-based films, a city of madness and cacophony, where flesh and drugs are traded and everywhere there are children like Krishna, surviving and succumbing to the appetite of the raging metropolis. Movingly acted by real street kids this film is an eloquent addition to the cinema’s portraits of troubled childhood.

results.title: Sailor Moon. Ep 8: The Doom tree strikes [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Junichi Sato, Louise Hurtubise and Toei Animation
results.brief_description: Six episodes of the Japanese animated television series, “Sailor Moon”, entitled “The doom tree strikes”. The setting is Cross Roads Junior High School, and Serena, a young girl possesses a magical brooch that invokes mystical forces, transforming her into the powerful Sailor Moon, a super-heroine whose mission is to protect humanity from evil demons from a parallel universe. Fellow Sailor Scouts, Jupiter, Mercury and Mars join her on her adventures. Episodes featured are: “A Knight to remember” When a monstrous creature attacks the Sailor crew, a mysterious knight (could it be Darien?) comes to the rescue; “VR madness” A virtual reality theatre is the location for the mega-verse’s latest assault, but without her tiara, Serena is helpless to aid her imperilled family. “Cherry blossom time” Sailor Moon and her friends are in danger when they are captured by alien beings. “Kindergarten chaos” Several potent beings with malevolent intentions threaten the lives of kindergarten children, until the Sailor crew intervene. “Much ado about babysitting” Darien and Sailor Moon baby-sit together whilst evil forces try to rob babies of their energy. “Raye’s day in the spotlight” Raye organises and stars in the Autumn festival but a monster from a mega-verse makes a guest appearance. Based on the original comic “Sailor Moon” by Naoko Takeuchi, the series is underpinned by the decent moral codes of friendship, honesty, responsible behaviour, respect and selflessness.

results.title: Sail away
results.creator_credit: Bruce Mackay, Roman Kroitor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A boy named Gus accepts an invitation to spend several days aboard the trimaran Freya. During the cruise he is instructed in the rudiments of sailing and is entrusted with the helm. Ever curious, Gus is taught to identify various forms of marine life. There is a particularly striking sequence of a storm at sea that Gus, the skipper, and the Freya ride out handsomely.

results.title: Sacred sex (E)
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Connop, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Triple Image
results.brief_description: The tantric tradition of sensual spirituality was an esoteric and mystical religious tradition which flourished in Ancient India and China. The tantric rites of sexuality are now finding a new wave of adherents among the “new agers” of the post-industrial West. This video explores the sexual research and experimentation taking place in cities such as Berlin, New York, Aspen and San Francisco by western people attempting the difficult reconciliation of erotic desires and spiritual fulfilment when they have been raised in a Christian culture which fundamentally opposes the spirit and the body. From a “Sluts and Goddess” workshop hosted by famous dominatrix Annie Sprinkler, to a “Rebirthing and Sexuality” conference in Hawaii, “Sacred Sex” explores the new forms of pagan and Eastern philosophies being popularised in the West.

results.title: Sabrina: friends forever [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Scott Heming, Chuck Grimes and DIC Entertainment
results.brief_description: Feature length animated TV movie version of “Sabrina” the animated series, based on the live-action sitcom. Sabrina, a teenage witch, prepares for boarding school and attends witch academy, to learn about potions and spells, but Sabrina’s secret origins (half-human, half-witch), set her apart from her peers, from whom she fears ostracizing. Overwhelmed by her new environment, Sabrina is impressed by the snooty attitude and wealth of fellow student, Portia, whose acquaintances accept Sabrina but are unaware of her half-witch status. When Sabrina befriends another half-witch Nicole, a girl spurned by the in-group, and the pair aid each other’s transition into witch-hood, the kind-hearted Sabrina learns the perils of slavish conformity in order to belong. Academy rules are that a witch is true to her friends, true to herself and uses magic wisely, themes which the narrative supports through Sabrina’s at school experiences. This film, suitable for children and pitched at teens and pre-teens, has an endearing comic tone that supports the funky neo-feminist values of ‘girl power’.

results.description: Feature length animated TV movie version of “Sabrina” the animated series, based on the live-action sitcom. Sabrina, a teenage witch, prepares for boarding school and attends witch academy, to learn about potions and spells, but Sabrina’s secret origins (half-human, half-witch), set her apart from her peers, from whom she fears ostracizing. Overwhelmed by her new environment, Sabrina is impressed by the snooty attitude and wealth of fellow student, Portia, whose acquaintances accept Sabrina but are unaware of her half-witch status. When Sabrina befriends another half-witch Nicole, a girl spurned by the in-group, and the pair aid each other’s transition into witch-hood, the kind-hearted Sabrina learns the perils of slavish conformity in order to belong. Academy rules are that a witch is true to her friends, true to herself and uses magic wisely, themes which the narrative supports through Sabrina’s at school experiences. This film, suitable for children and pitched at teens and pre-teens, has an endearing comic tone that supports the funky neo-feminist values of ‘girl power’.
